FuncDef:
The trunkport command adds an interface to an Eth-Trunk interface in the Eth-Trunk interface view.
The undo trunkport command deletes an interface from an Eth-Trunk interface in the Eth-Trunk interface view. The trunkport command adds an interface to an Eth-Trunk interface in the Eth-Trunk interface view. The undo trunkport command deletes an interface from an Eth-Trunk interface in the Eth-Trunk interface view. By default, no member interface is added to an Eth-Trunk interface.
ParentView: Layer 2 Eth-Trunk interface view,Eth-Trunk interface view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the start number of the Eth-Trunk interface.
The value is a string of 1 to 49 case-sensitive characters. It cannot contain spaces.

Specifies the end number of the Eth-Trunk interface.
The value is a string of 1 to 49 case-sensitive characters. It cannot contain spaces.

Specifies the name of the interface that is added to the Eth-Trunk interface.
The value is a string of 1 to 49 case-sensitive characters. It cannot contain spaces.

Specifies the type of the interface that is added to the Eth-Trunk interface.
-

ExtraInfo: To increase bandwidth, improve reliability, and implement load balancing, you can run this command to add physical interfaces to an Eth-Trunk interface in batches.
